title.value: Crop yield of winter wheat varieties in the southern region of the Republic of Belarus
Урожайность сортов озимой пшеницы в южном регионе Республики Беларусь

journal.title: Agriculture and Plant Protection : scientific-practical journal

person.name: Kulinkovich, S.N., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Scientific and Practical Center for  Arable Farming
Kravtsov, S.V., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Gomel Regional Agricultural Experimental Station (Belarus)

abstract.value: The study of winter wheat (Triticum aestivum) collection material was conducted. It was established that on average for two years, the highest yield was formed by the variety of Zawisha (Poland) such as 67,5 hundreds kilograms per hectare, which is higher than the standard by 10,4  hundreds kilograms per hectare. Varietal reaction to weather conditions during the growing season was revealed. It was established that by such characters as 'yield' and 'adaptability', the whole list of the analyzed varieties could be divided into four groups as follows: the varieties which did not significantly react to the growing conditions; the varieties with high productivity and high range of variation of that character; the varieties forming high yield in hot weather with high moisture supply and the varieties which form high yields in hot weather with precipitation deficit.
